TopicTitle: Multiple Cfgs. To a single model and texture?

Articles.Content:
I've seen that some mods use a single parts folder for multiple parts that may be rescaled versions of the same model and texture. Is this done simply by putting more than one CFg in the folder and giving some rescale factors or is there an extra step that needs to be taken.

My plan is to create a bunch of armor panels for my PEW mod and I want to minimize memory usage as much as possible by using only five models and textures for 14 parts (each with a heavy and light armor variant so actually 28 parts)

Also I'd like to not bloat the list too much so how do I ate up the switchable setup system that some fuel tanks use to make the part change to new parameters or is this not possible (8 want to change its mass impact tolerance and heat resistance)
check out the Lack's SXT mod. He uses the technique you describe extensively.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107791-1-0-2-Mobile-Frame-System-MFS-%28v0-3-2%29-05-05-2015 MFS almost entirely relies on the part switching, which I think requires Firespitter for the module. And when putting multiple configs in the same folder (or in any case), make sure the name field is different, otherwise it will get interesting.
